climbs.name: Anytime Soon
climbs.fa: Unless otherwise known: Jack Spessard September 4, 2019

content.description: Start left hand low crimp, right hand sidepull, trend up and left on crimps, big move to top out just to the right of the tree. V7/V8
content.protection: 1-2 crash pads. Safe landing, just cover the rock.
content.location: This is the biggest, slightly overhanging boulder next to the trail. You will take a quick right turn on the trail as you approach Preacher's Rock and the boulder will be on your left. It seems to be leaning against a small tree (see picture) which is the most obvious landmark. If you come up on Preacher's Rock, you've gone too far. The boulder will be about 100ft down the trail and on your right.

content.description: This area can be crowded on holiday weekends or during the summer, but I have never run into complications. It is very shaded and much more windy than the approach trail. The best time to climb would be early to late evening. 2 hours before the sun set is when the temperatures get really good. The rocks stay relatively cool and dry due to wind and tree coverage.
